definition: successor
to continue/to follow after/to go on with/to succeed/to inherit/then/afterwards
surname Ren/Ren County 任縣|任县[Ren2 Xian4] in Hebei

to assign/to appoint/to take up a post/office/responsibility/to let/to allow/to give free rein to/no matter (how, what etc)/classifier for terms served in office, or for spouses, girlfriends etc (as in 前任男友)

(after a verb or adjective) one who (is) .../(after a noun) person involved in .../-er/-ist/(used after a number or 後|后[hou4] or 前[qian2] to refer to sth mentioned previously)/(used after a term, to mark a pause before defining the term)/(old) (used at the end of a command)/(old) this

sentences.english: His successor, Prajadhipok, Rama VII, fared worse.
sentences.chinese: 其继任者拉玛七世境遇则更糟。

sentences.english: For a month the governer had dilly- dallied over the choice of a succe or.
sentences.chinese: 州长对于选择继任者磨磨蹭蹭了一个月。

sentences.english: Nehru was succeeded by Lal Bahadur Shastri, who also died in office.
sentences.chinese: 尼赫鲁的继任者拉尔巴阿杜夏斯，谁也死在办公室。

sentences.english: Freddie is beginning its search for a long-term successor for Mr. Moffett.
sentences.chinese: 房地美正开始为莫菲特寻找一位长期的继任者。

sentences.english: Yes, Coen’s successor told them firmly.
sentences.chinese: 值得，科恩的继任者坚定地对他们说。

sentences.english: These are legacies that will haunt his successor for years.
sentences.chinese: 他的继任者在未来数年都将被这些笼罩。

sentences.english: However, his successor, Lee Myung-bak, has wrenched policy towards American security once more.
sentences.chinese: 然而他的继任者李明博又把政策扭向了美国安全一边。

sentences.english: And now the PC3's successor has arrived.
sentences.chinese: 而现在的PC3的继任者已经到来。

sentences.english: Shareholders expressed confidence that Buffett has the succession issue well in hand.
sentences.chinese: 股东们表示他们相信巴菲特在继任者问题上胸有成竹。

sentences.english: Today, it's the city-state that's being touted as the successor to the nation-state.
sentences.chinese: 现在倒是“城邦”被吹捧为民族国家的继任者。

sentences.english: The company said Holley's successor will be named later.
sentences.chinese: 公司说霍利是继任者将在稍晚被任命。

sentences.english: His successor inherited a lot of problems from him.
sentences.chinese: 他的继任者从他手中接过不少问题。

sentences.english: AKQA says it is looking for a replacement for his role in the industry.
sentences.chinese: AKQA称，公司正在业内寻找朱的继任者。

sentences.english: For a month the governer had dilly- dallied over the choice of a successor.
sentences.chinese: 州长对于选择继任者磨磨蹭蹭了一个月。

sentences.english: Thiam is Tucker’s successor at Prudential.
sentences.chinese: 谭天忠正是塔克在保诚保险的继任者。

sentences.english: Andrew Johnson, who succeeded Lincoln, was born in 1808.
sentences.chinese: 安德鲁约翰逊，林肯的继任者，出生于1808年。

definition: to succeed sb in a job/successor
to replace/to take over (a position or post)
to take over (as minister, manager etc)
newly-appointed/newly elected/new (in a political office)
to leave office
to leave office/to leave one's post
to wield (power etc)
substitute
to take office/previous (incumbent)/predecessor
next office holder/next to serve
successor
to ride to take up an official appointment (idiom); to take on a job with alacrity/to undertake a task
successor
to take over (from those working the previous shift)/to take over (in a leadership role etc)/to succeed sb
to take over (duties etc)/catcher (baseball etc)
to remain in office/to hold on to one's job
